intro: Antennaria speciosa, commonly known as the showy mouseear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which bloom in the spring, are pink to purple in color and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Antennaria speciosa is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
